articles.headline: Putting Twitter’s World to Use
articles.snippet: Collectively, Twitter’s messages are a surprisingly useful tool for solving problems and revealing public opinion.
articles.abstract: Collectively, Twitter’s messages are a surprisingly useful tool for solving problems and revealing public opinion.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The first reaction many people have to Twitter is befuddlement. Why would they want to read short messages about what someone ate for breakfast?

articles.headline: Brand Names Live After Stores Close
articles.snippet: Liquidators of stores like Linens ‘n Things and Sharper Image are using the names to sell new products.
articles.abstract: Liquidators of stores like Linens ‘n Things and Sharper Image are using the names to sell new products.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the last year or so, a string of retailers have gone into bankruptcy  Sharper Image, Linens ’n Things, Circuit City and Fortunoff among them. But while the stores have disappeared, their names live on.

articles.headline: Goldman Posts Profit and Plans Share Sale
articles.snippet: Reporting strong quarterly profits, Goldman wants to extricate itself from government control six months after taking funds.
articles.abstract: Reporting strong quarterly profits, Goldman wants to extricate itself from government control six months after taking funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Six months after accepting a financial lifeline from Washington, a newly profitable Goldman Sachs is pushing to return the billions of taxpayer dollars that it received in an effort to extricate itself from heightened government control.

articles.headline: United Militants Threaten Pakistan’s Populous Heart
articles.snippet: The Taliban is teaming up with militant groups in Punjab, posing a risk to the country’s stability.
articles.abstract: The Taliban is teaming up with militant groups in Punjab, posing a risk to the country’s stability.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Sabrina Tavernise, Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Eric Schmitt and written by Ms. Tavernise.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise, Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Amazon Says Error Removed Listings
articles.snippet: A computer error that caused thousands of books on Amazon.com to lose their sales rankings led to cries of censorship from some critics.
articles.abstract: A computer error that caused thousands of books on Amazon.com to lose their sales rankings led to cries of censorship from some critics.
articles.lead_paragraph: In response to nearly two days of angry online commentary, particularly on Twitter, Amazon.com said on Monday that “an embarrassing and ham-fisted cataloging error” had caused thousands of books on its site to lose their sales rankings and become harder to find in searches.

articles.headline: U.S. May Drop Key Condition for Talks With Iran
articles.snippet: New proposals would allow Tehran to continue enriching uranium during negotiations, officials say, a sharp break from the Bush administration’s approach.
articles.abstract: New proposals would allow Tehran to continue enriching uranium during negotiations, officials say, a sharp break from the Bush administration’s approach.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration and its European allies are preparing proposals that would shift strategy toward Iran by dropping a longstanding American insistence that Tehran rapidly shut down nuclear facilities during the early phases of negotiations over its atomic program, according to officials involved in the discussions.

articles.headline: Glamour Dims as Hecklers Hit the Auto Show
articles.snippet: Long a glamorous showcase for carmakers, auto shows have lately become a place for buyers and gawkers to vent.
articles.abstract: Long a glamorous showcase for carmakers, auto shows have lately become a place for buyers and gawkers to vent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a year ago, working as a product presenter at an auto show was a pretty straightforward job. You stood next to a vehicle, you called it a marvel of engineering, style and comfort and then you fielded softball questions like, “What does this baby cost?”

articles.headline: Immigration Accord by Labor Boosts Obama Effort
articles.snippet: The nation’s two major labor federations have agreed for the first time to join forces to support immigration reform.
articles.abstract: The nation’s two major labor federations have agreed for the first time to join forces to support immigration reform.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s two major labor federations have agreed for the first time to join forces to support an overhaul of the immigration system, leaders of both organizations said on Monday. The accord could give President Obama significant support among unions as he revisits the stormy issue in the midst of the recession.
articles.byline: By Julia Preston and Steven Greenhouse

articles.headline: Cuomo Tries to Enforce Notification to Debtors
articles.snippet: The New York attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, plans to file a civil suit Tuesday against a company that failed to give notice to debtors of collections proceedings.
articles.abstract: The New York attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, plans to file a civil suit Tuesday against a company that failed to give notice to debtors of collections proceedings.
articles.lead_paragraph: It may be the consumer nightmare of the moment: You try to get cash from an A.T.M. and discover that your money is gone, seized under a court order that you never knew about.
